meanings.definition: To clothe or dress in a vestment or robe.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys vesturing herself in elegant robes for special occasions.
meanings.sent2: The priest carefully vestured himself in the ceremonial vestments before the service.
meanings.sent3: The children found it amusing to vesturing their dolls in tiny robes.
meanings.sent4: The autumn leaves vesturing the trees in vibrant colors created a picturesque scene.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes seemed to vesturing life onto the canvas.

meanings.definition: The act of investing with a robe or vestment.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the vesturing of the new bishop was a solemn moment.
meanings.sent2: The vesturing of the king in regal robes symbolized his authority.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up in the vesturing of costumes led to a comical scene on stage.
meanings.sent4: The vesturing of the statue in gold leaf made it gleam in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The vesturing of the room in rich tapestries added a touch of luxury.
